availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James William Conine (Orange County, New York, printer and U.S. Army colonel)

body.p: Orange County, New York, printer and soldier. Connecticut native. Son of Peter Conine and Susan Conine. Married to Fannie L. Curtis Conine in Meigs County, Ohio, on October 9, 1862. Father of Hellen Conine and Mary Conine. Printer in Orange County in 1860. Served in the 1st Kentucky Independent Battery (U.S.A.) as lieutenant from June 3, 1861, to November 19, 1863. Colonel of the 5th United States Colored Infantry Regiment from December 1, 1863, to September 13, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, New York, Orange County, Wallkill, p. 28.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Ohio, Franklin County, Columbus, Ward 9, p. 444A.
Ohio, U.S., County Marriage Records, 1774-1993, Various Ohio County Courthouses, Meigs County Marriages, 1862-1869, Film #000313454, p. 16.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers who Served in Organizations From State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0479.
U.S. Civil War Pension Index: General Index to Pension Files, 1861-1934, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series T288, Application #255614, Certificate #286113.
Historical Register of National Homes for Disabled Volunteer Soldiers, 1866-1938, NARA RG 15, Microfilm Series M1749, Dayton Registers, p. 1349 of 5222 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
New York, U.S., Episcopal Diocese of New York Church Records, 1767-1970, The Episcopal Diocese of New York Church Records, New York, New York, Manhattan, St. Andrews, 1835-1940, p. 4 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, "COL James W Conine (1836-1895)," Memorial #179240507, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/179240507 (accessed January 22, 2021).
